usefulItems: parchment paper, pastry brush, rolling pin, baking sheet, ruler, oven
title: Christmas Tree Spinach Puff

ingredients.content: ¼ tsp dried red pepper flakes, to taste
10 oz frozen chopped spinach, thawed, squeezed
sweety drop miniature peppers, to garnish

preparations.content: Lay 2 sheets of parchment on a work surface. Roll out two sheets of puff pastry (9 in. x 12 in.) on prepared parchments and set aside.
Place cheddar and Parmesan cheeses into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, parsley, basil, oregano, dried onion, rosemary, salt and red pepper flakes into mixing bowl and grind <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add spinach, cream cheese and reserved grated cheese and mix <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>.

Evenly spread spinach mixture over one sheet reserved rolled out puff pastry. Cover with second sheet of pastry and gently roll over dough with a rolling pin to seal the two pieces together. Cut out a large triangle, or tree shape from pastry (see Tip). Transfer prepared tree with parchment to a baking sheet.

To make tree branches, place a ruler down the center of the tree. With a sharp knife, evenly cut strips from the edge of tree, towards the ruler, leaving the center intact. Twist each strip to form branches.
In a small bowl, whisk egg and water until combined. Brush the assembled tree with egg wash.
Bake for 20-25 minutes (400°F) until puffed and golden brown. Garnish with sweety drops and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Use excess pastry to make twisty straws, cut out with cookie cutters or form into a second spinach tree.
